name: Saves
disc:
A completely new way to save recipes on Genius Kitchen and Food Network. Saves replaces Recipe Box, which remained essentially unchanged since launch in 2013. The webapp is built using Vuejs, which significantly increases site speed and time-to-launch owing to the modular, progressive nature of the framework.

Personal responsibilities included visual design for web and Android, as well as visual UAT in the form of authoring Sass stylesheets and light JavaScript to ensure the final product matched the vision.

name: Genius Kitchen
disc:
Rebrand and relaunch of Food.com to Genius Kitchen (GK) a cooking and food entertainment OTT micronetwork.

Personal responsibilities included visual design, as well as visual UAT in the form of authoring Less stylesheets.

name: GK Front End Library
disc:
Internal companion site documenting UI patterns, colors, swatches and other tools for maintaining the Genius Kitchen website. Uses an encapsulated copy of the css styling for the GK site, so everything displays as it would on the live site.

Personally designed, built and maintained using HTML, JavaScript and Less; compiled with Grunt.js

name: Food.com
disc:
Food.com (now rebranded as Genius Kitchen) was completely reimagined from the ground up, including a new branding package to attract a younger audience, new site architecture and refactored front and backends to remove the aggregate cruft of the previous 10 years.

Modern design methodologies and techniques such as mobile first and responsive design were utilized to create a lightweight, easily-maintained footprint, and tools such as a forked version of Bootstrap, dynamic image resizing and a custom-designed icon font (foodicons) brought the technology up to date. The result was a faster, leaner site with larger photos, fewer ‚Äúwalls of text‚Äù and a friendlier, younger voice.

Personal responsibilities included an adaptation of the visual grid system to facilitate breakpoints and fluid widths, visual design, visual UAT in the form of authoring less stylesheets, and the creation and maintenance of a companion living style guide site dubbed the “Front-end Library.”

name: Cooking Channel
disc:
A new food-centric network and website. Unlike other food websites in the Scripps portfolio, the on-air network branding was derived from the system developed for the web property.

Personal responsibilities included visual design, asset creation as well as visual UAT.

name: Jewell Net v2.0
